  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public static void initialize()
      Called once at the beginning of each chess game to put pieces in their starting positions, and initialize other tiles on the board as null.

    • printBoard

      public static void printBoard()
      Draws the board in the specified format.

    • isIllegal

      public static boolean isIllegal​(java.lang.String s, int i)
      Method to determine whether a move is illegal.
      Parameters:
      s - The move entered by the user in chess notation.
      i - Odd number means white's turn, even number means black's turn.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the move is valid, false if the move is invalid.

    • makeMove

      public static void makeMove​(java.lang.String s, int i)
      Method to make a move on the chessboard.
      Parameters:
      s - The move entered by the user in chess notation.
      i - Odd number means white's turn, even number means black's turn.

    • isCheckmate

      public static boolean isCheckmate​(char color)
      Method to determine whether the specified king is in checkmate.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the king under consideration.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the king is checkmated, false otherwise.

    • isCheck

      public static boolean isCheck​(char color)
      Method to determine whether the specified king is in check.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the king under consideration.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the king is in check, false otherwise.

    • getKingPos

      public static int[] getKingPos​(char color)
      Returns an integer array of length 2 with the position of the King of the specified color. The first entry in the array holds the row index (0 for the first row and 7 for the last), and the second holds the column index (0 for the first column, 7 for the last).
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the king under consideration.
      Returns:
      Returns an integer array of 2 integers which store the row and column index of the King, respectively, to be used in accessing the King in the 2D-array "board".

    • searchInDirection

      public static int[] searchInDirection​(int yPos, int xPos, java.lang.String direction, int dist)
      Given a starting tile on the "board" and a direction, returns an integer array with the position of the first Piece found. If no piece is found, then the last position checked on the board is returned.
      Parameters:
      yPos - The row index (0-7) of the starting tile.
      xPos - The column index (0-7) of the starting tile.
      direction - One of the 8 directions ("NE", "E", "SE", ...) that will be searched for a Piece.
      dist - The maximum distance that will be searched in the direction.
      Returns:
      Returns an integer array storing the row and column index and the first Piece found, or the last board position checked (if no Piece is found).

    • getPossMoves

      public static java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getPossMoves​(Piece p, int yPos, int xPos)
      Given a piece and its location, returns a list of possible moves, stored as integer arrays. The 2 entries in each array hold the row and column index, respectively, of the possible positions which the Piece may move to. This method does not check if the possible moves result in a check.
      Parameters:
      p - The Piece to be checked for possible moves.
      yPos - The row index (0-7) of the starting tile of p.
      xPos - The column index (0-7) of the starting tile of p.
      Returns:
      Returns an ArrayList of integer arrays.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Method to play a chess game.
      Parameters:
      args - No command-line arguments.
